definitions: A thing that floats, in particular.
A small, light object, typically made of cork or plastic, attached to a fishing line to indicate when a fish has bitten.
A device for making something float.
A drink consisting of ice cream in a carbonated drink or fruit juice.
A hand tool with a blade, used for paring or smoothing.
A flat-topped, low-slung vehicle used to carry an exhibit in a procession or parade.
examples: The floats bobbed on the water.
He ordered a root beer float.
